intro: Brachytome wallichii, commonly known as the Himalayan bristlegrass, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Asia. It belongs to the grass family Poaceae and is characterized by its compact growth habit and tufted foliage. The plant produces small, spike-like inflorescences that bear tiny, wind-pollinated flowers. Brachytome wallichii typically thrives in high-altitude environments with cool, moist conditions. Its botanical features make it an important component of alpine ecosystems in its native range.
